## Burney Fire Protection District, California, Measure F, Public Safety Services Parcel Tax Measure (November 2024)

“A YES vote would allow the Burney Fire Protection District to continue to provide existing ambulance/emergency medical care, fire protection services, rescue and hazardous material response. Shall an ordinance be adopted authorizing an annual, parcel tax on all nonexempt parcels within the District, with rates based on land use, including a maximum rate of $75 per single-family home, with approximately $237,994 annually, until ended by voters?”
## California Proposition 2, Public Education Facilities Bond Measure (2024)
“Authorizes bonds for public school and community college facilities. Legislative statute.[5]”
## California Proposition 3, Right to Marry and Repeal Proposition 8 Amendment (2024)
“Constitutional right to marriage. Legislative constitutional amendment.[6]”
## California Proposition 33, Prohibit State Limitations on Local Rent Control Initiative (2024)
“Expands local governments' authority to enact rent control on residential property. Initiative statute.[7]”
## California Proposition 34, Require Certain Participants in Medi-Cal Rx Program to Spend 98% of Revenues on Patient Care Initiative (2024)
“Restricts spending by health care providers meeting specified criteria. Initiative statute.[7]”
## California Proposition 35, Managed Care Organization Tax Authorization Initiative (2024)
“Provides permanent funding for Medi-Cal Health Care Services. Initiative statute.[7]”
## California Proposition 36, Drug and Theft Crime Penalties and Treatment-Mandated Felonies Initiative (2024)
“Allows felony charges and increases sentences for certain drug and theft crimes. Initiative statute.[10]”
## California Proposition 4, Parks, Environment, Energy, and Water Bond Measure (2024)
“Authorizes bonds for safe drinking water, wildfire prevention, and protecting communities and natural lands from climate risks. Legislative statute.[5]”
## California Proposition 5, Lower Supermajority Requirement to 55% for Local Bond Measures to Fund Housing and Public Infrastructure Amendment (2024)
“Allows local bonds for affordable housing and public infrastructure with 55% voter approval. Legislative constitutional amendment.[6]”
## California Proposition 6, Remove Involuntary Servitude as Punishment for Crime Amendment (2024)
“Eliminates constitutional provision allowing involuntary servitude for incarcerated persons. Legislative constitutional amendment.[5]”
## Cottonwood Union School District, California, Measure E, School Infrastructure Improvement Bond Measure (November 2024)

“To improve the quality of schools; replace leaky roofs; modernize/construct/renovate classrooms, restrooms and school facilities; replace HVAC and plumbing systems; make health, safety and security improvements; and upgrade inadequate electrical and communication systems; shall Cottonwood Union School District's measure be adopted authorizing $9,600,000 of bonds, at legal rates, generating on average $604,000 annually while bonds are outstanding, at rates of approximately $30 per $100,000 assessed value, with annual audits, citizens' oversight, all money staying local?”
## Shasta County, California, Measure P, Eminent Domain Charter Amendment Measure (November 2024)

“Shall Measure P (Adding to the Shasta County Charter) be adopted?This measure adds a subsection to the Shasta County Charter. The proposed addition would limit the County's exercise of eminent domain.”
## Shasta County, California, Measure Q, Appointment or Special Election for Board Vacancy Charter Amendment Measure (November 2024)

“Shall Measure Q (Adding to the Shasta County Charter) be adopted? This measure adds a subsection to the Shasta County Charter. The proposed addition would allow for Members of the Board of Supervisors to appoint or call for a special election to fill an unplanned mid-term vacancy of designated elected department heads.”
*This report provides an AI-assisted analysis of ballot complexity. Please note that this is a supplementary analysis and not a substitute for official election information.*
**This ballot is more complex than 94 percent of U.S. Ballots.**

## Burney Fire Protection District, California, Measure F, Public Safety Services Parcel Tax Measure (November 2024)

“A YES vote would allow the Burney Fire Protection District to continue to provide existing ambulance/emergency medical care, fire protection services, rescue and hazardous material response. Shall an ordinance be adopted authorizing an annual, parcel tax on all nonexempt parcels within the District, with rates based on land use, including a maximum rate of $75 per single-family home, with approximately $237,994 annually, until ended by voters?”
## California Proposition 2, Public Education Facilities Bond Measure (2024)
“Authorizes bonds for public school and community college facilities. Legislative statute.[5]”
## California Proposition 3, Right to Marry and Repeal Proposition 8 Amendment (2024)
“Constitutional right to marriage. Legislative constitutional amendment.[6]”
## California Proposition 33, Prohibit State Limitations on Local Rent Control Initiative (2024)
“Expands local governments' authority to enact rent control on residential property. Initiative statute.[7]”
## California Proposition 34, Require Certain Participants in Medi-Cal Rx Program to Spend 98% of Revenues on Patient Care Initiative (2024)
“Restricts spending by health care providers meeting specified criteria. Initiative statute.[7]”
## California Proposition 35, Managed Care Organization Tax Authorization Initiative (2024)
“Provides permanent funding for Medi-Cal Health Care Services. Initiative statute.[7]”
## California Proposition 36, Drug and Theft Crime Penalties and Treatment-Mandated Felonies Initiative (2024)
“Allows felony charges and increases sentences for certain drug and theft crimes. Initiative statute.[10]”
## California Proposition 4, Parks, Environment, Energy, and Water Bond Measure (2024)
“Authorizes bonds for safe drinking water, wildfire prevention, and protecting communities and natural lands from climate risks. Legislative statute.[5]”
## California Proposition 5, Lower Supermajority Requirement to 55% for Local Bond Measures to Fund Housing and Public Infrastructure Amendment (2024)
“Allows local bonds for affordable housing and public infrastructure with 55% voter approval. Legislative constitutional amendment.[6]”
## California Proposition 6, Remove Involuntary Servitude as Punishment for Crime Amendment (2024)
“Eliminates constitutional provision allowing involuntary servitude for incarcerated persons. Legislative constitutional amendment.[5]”
## Cottonwood Union School District, California, Measure E, School Infrastructure Improvement Bond Measure (November 2024)

“To improve the quality of schools; replace leaky roofs; modernize/construct/renovate classrooms, restrooms and school facilities; replace HVAC and plumbing systems; make health, safety and security improvements; and upgrade inadequate electrical and communication systems; shall Cottonwood Union School District's measure be adopted authorizing $9,600,000 of bonds, at legal rates, generating on average $604,000 annually while bonds are outstanding, at rates of approximately $30 per $100,000 assessed value, with annual audits, citizens' oversight, all money staying local?”
## Shasta County, California, Measure P, Eminent Domain Charter Amendment Measure (November 2024)

“Shall Measure P (Adding to the Shasta County Charter) be adopted?This measure adds a subsection to the Shasta County Charter. The proposed addition would limit the County's exercise of eminent domain.”
## Shasta County, California, Measure Q, Appointment or Special Election for Board Vacancy Charter Amendment Measure (November 2024)

“Shall Measure Q (Adding to the Shasta County Charter) be adopted? This measure adds a subsection to the Shasta County Charter. The proposed addition would allow for Members of the Board of Supervisors to appoint or call for a special election to fill an unplanned mid-term vacancy of designated elected department heads.”

- **Claudia De La Cruz** (Peace and Freedom Party)
## Rio Alto Water District Board At-large
## California Proposition 2, Public Education Facilities Bond Measure (2024)
“Authorizes bonds for public school and community college facilities. Legislative statute.[5]”
## California Proposition 3, Right to Marry and Repeal Proposition 8 Amendment (2024)
“Constitutional right to marriage. Legislative constitutional amendment.[6]”
## California Proposition 33, Prohibit State Limitations on Local Rent Control Initiative (2024)
“Expands local governments' authority to enact rent control on residential property. Initiative statute.[7]”
## California Proposition 34, Require Certain Participants in Medi-Cal Rx Program to Spend 98% of Revenues on Patient Care Initiative (2024)
“Restricts spending by health care providers meeting specified criteria. Initiative statute.[7]”
## California Proposition 35, Managed Care Organization Tax Authorization Initiative (2024)
“Provides permanent funding for Medi-Cal Health Care Services. Initiative statute.[7]”
## California Proposition 36, Drug and Theft Crime Penalties and Treatment-Mandated Felonies Initiative (2024)
“Allows felony charges and increases sentences for certain drug and theft crimes. Initiative statute.[10]”
## California Proposition 4, Parks, Environment, Energy, and Water Bond Measure (2024)
“Authorizes bonds for safe drinking water, wildfire prevention, and protecting communities and natural lands from climate risks. Legislative statute.[5]”
## California Proposition 5, Lower Supermajority Requirement to 55% for Local Bond Measures to Fund Housing and Public Infrastructure Amendment (2024)
“Allows local bonds for affordable housing and public infrastructure with 55% voter approval. Legislative constitutional amendment.[6]”
## California Proposition 6, Remove Involuntary Servitude as Punishment for Crime Amendment (2024)
“Eliminates constitutional provision allowing involuntary servitude for incarcerated persons. Legislative constitutional amendment.[5]”
## Red Bluff Joint Union High School District, California, Measure L, School Infrastructure Improvement Bond Measure (November 2024)

“To upgrade local schools with classrooms/ facilities preparing students for future jobs and apprenticeships; replace leaky roofs, plumbing, electrical; improve campus safety and supervision/ wellness of students; acquire/ construct/ modernize facilities, shall Red Bluff Joint Union High School District's measure authorizing $33.6 million of bonds at legal rates, levying 3¢ per $100 of assessed value (averaging $2.5 million annually) while bonds are outstanding, be adopted with citizen oversight, annual audits, no money for administrators?”
*This report provides an AI-assisted analysis of ballot complexity. Please note that this is a supplementary analysis and not a substitute for official election information.*
**This ballot is more complex than 62 percent of U.S. Ballots.**

column4: Evergreen Union School District, At-large, Rio Alto Water District Board At-large

column1: - **Claudia De La Cruz** (Peace and Freedom Party)
## Rio Alto Water District Board At-large
## California Proposition 2, Public Education Facilities Bond Measure (2024)
“Authorizes bonds for public school and community college facilities. Legislative statute.[5]”
## California Proposition 3, Right to Marry and Repeal Proposition 8 Amendment (2024)
“Constitutional right to marriage. Legislative constitutional amendment.[6]”
## California Proposition 33, Prohibit State Limitations on Local Rent Control Initiative (2024)
“Expands local governments' authority to enact rent control on residential property. Initiative statute.[7]”
## California Proposition 34, Require Certain Participants in Medi-Cal Rx Program to Spend 98% of Revenues on Patient Care Initiative (2024)
“Restricts spending by health care providers meeting specified criteria. Initiative statute.[7]”
## California Proposition 35, Managed Care Organization Tax Authorization Initiative (2024)
“Provides permanent funding for Medi-Cal Health Care Services. Initiative statute.[7]”
## California Proposition 36, Drug and Theft Crime Penalties and Treatment-Mandated Felonies Initiative (2024)
“Allows felony charges and increases sentences for certain drug and theft crimes. Initiative statute.[10]”
## California Proposition 4, Parks, Environment, Energy, and Water Bond Measure (2024)
“Authorizes bonds for safe drinking water, wildfire prevention, and protecting communities and natural lands from climate risks. Legislative statute.[5]”
## California Proposition 5, Lower Supermajority Requirement to 55% for Local Bond Measures to Fund Housing and Public Infrastructure Amendment (2024)
“Allows local bonds for affordable housing and public infrastructure with 55% voter approval. Legislative constitutional amendment.[6]”
## California Proposition 6, Remove Involuntary Servitude as Punishment for Crime Amendment (2024)
“Eliminates constitutional provision allowing involuntary servitude for incarcerated persons. Legislative constitutional amendment.[5]”
## Red Bluff Joint Union High School District, California, Measure L, School Infrastructure Improvement Bond Measure (November 2024)

“To upgrade local schools with classrooms/ facilities preparing students for future jobs and apprenticeships; replace leaky roofs, plumbing, electrical; improve campus safety and supervision/ wellness of students; acquire/ construct/ modernize facilities, shall Red Bluff Joint Union High School District's measure authorizing $33.6 million of bonds at legal rates, levying 3¢ per $100 of assessed value (averaging $2.5 million annually) while bonds are outstanding, be adopted with citizen oversight, annual audits, no money for administrators?”
